ygData.subject: Heritrix 1.6 Priorities
ygData.msgSnippet: Here are what we here at the Archive see as priorities for the 1.6 release of Heritrix. The General Theme will be remote job-control and monitoring

Subject: Heritrix 1.6 Priorities
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

Here are what we here at the Archive see as priorities for the 1.6 
release of Heritrix. 

The "General Theme" will be "remote job-control and monitoring 
support".   This is needed so crawls can be launched and controlled by a 
separate crawl controller application.  A distinct crawl controller 
implementation we intend experimenting with in the 1.6 time frame will 
attempt coordination of multiple Heritrix instances doing crawls that 
are larger than a single-machine can handle.  We also intend addressing 
checkpointing, as well as continuing to work on improving memory usage 
and overall performance.  We're aiming for a June/July release.

What else do folks think we need to address in 1.6?  Is there anyting in 
particular on the list of RFEs -- 
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539102 -- that 
people would like us to prioritize?

Yours,
Heritrix Crew

(The above is adapted from Gordon's RoadMap page: 
http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?HeritrixRoadmapFor2005).
